thread.title: Greg Biffle says goodbye to beloved longtime pet dog
thread.title_full: Greg Biffle says goodbye to beloved longtime pet dog

title: Greg Biffle says goodbye to beloved longtime pet dog
text:
FOX Sports Jared Turner - Shake and Bake Crew Share This Story Updated Oct 8, 2015 at 1:08p ET 
Greg Biffle is grieving the loss of his longtime pet dog, Gracie, who passed away earlier this week. 
The driver of the No. 16 Roush Fenway Racing Ford announced the news on Twitter, a couple days ahead of this weekend's on-track activities at Charlotte Motor Speedway where Biffle will compete in Saturday night's Bank of America 500. true Gracie passed away today at 230pm 5/5/2003 - 10/6/2015 she was a great dog and will be missed RIP pic.twitter.com/Ox3GhGt1uk â€” Greg Biffle (@gbiffle) October 6, 2015 
Biffle, an animal lover, started his foundation in 2005 to create awareness and serve as advocate to improve the well-being of animals by engaging the power and passion of the motor sports industry. 
Financial support for the Greg Biffle Foundation comes from a variety of sources including individual contributions along with the sale of NASCAR Pets calendars and various racing and other sports memorabilia.
